title: The war where women are raped, drugged and held hostage
Judge rules Derek Chauvin murder trial will continue and stay in Minneapolis
description: A judge in Minneapolis Friday rejected defense motions to postpone and relocate Derek Chauvin's murder trial in the death of George Floyd.

title: Activist: Turkish government isn't supporting women
description: CNN's Christiane Amanpour discusses violence against women in Turkey with activist and novelist Elif Shafak.

title: US military says a third of troops opt out of vaccination, but the numbers suggest it's more
description: Despite a massive effort by the Pentagon to promote the safety and efficacy of Covid-19 vaccines, the US military's opt-out rate for vaccinations may be far higher than the 33% figure defense officials have used publicly.

title: NCAA women's basketball player calls out unequal conditions
description: The NCAA is being criticized for the lack of amenities at the 2021 women's basketball tournament compared to men's tournament.

title: Experts say two barriers stand in the way of reaching herd immunity in the US
description: States are pushing ahead with expanding Covid-19 vaccine access and rolling back restrictions on businesses and large gatherings as America seeks a return to normalcy.

title: White House staffers asked to resign or work remotely after revealing past marijuana use
description: Several White House staffers were asked to resign, were suspended or are working remotely after revealing past marijuana use during their background checks, sources familiar with the situation tell CNN.

title: 14 House Republicans vote against a measure condemning military coup in Myanmar
description: The House on Friday overwhelmingly supported a measure condemning the military coup in Myanmar that ousted the country's civilian leader, Aung San Suu Kyi. But some conservative Republicans didn't support the measure, and it's unclear why.

title: CNN reporter: People assume I don't speak English
description: CNN's Kyung Lah describes the discrimination she has faced as an Asian American woman in the US in the wake of the shooting in Atlanta that left six Asian women dead.

title: George W. Bush is unrecognizable in the current Republican Party
description: In an interview that aired Thursday with the Texas Tribune's Evan Smith, one thing about George W. Bush was: He is fundamentally at odds with the current version of the Republican Party on virtually every front.

title: US Ambassador to UN calls for dismantling of White supremacy
description: US Ambassador to the United Nations Linda Thomas-Greenfield on Friday called for the dismantling of White supremacy and for the world to "stand unified against this scourge" of racism.

title: Putin challenged Biden to debate. History shows why that's bad for Putin
description: CNN's Brianna Keilar rolls the tape on Russian President Vladimir Putin inviting Joe Biden to a live debate and goes through the history of political candidates challenging one another to debates.

title: Rangers boss Steven Gerrard calls for action after his player accuses Slavia Prague opponent of racist abuse
description: Rangers manager Steven Gerrard says he hopes the alleged racism directed at his player Glen Kamara during a match on Thursday does not get "brushed under the carpet."

title: Democrat introduces resolution to expel GOP Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene
description: Democratic Rep. Jimmy Gomez of California formally introduced a resolution Friday to expel Georgia Republican Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene from Congress, suggesting that she "advocated violence against our peers, the Speaker and our government."

title: SE Cupp: I didn't even know the Republican Party had one of these ...
description: CNN Political Commentator SE Cupp looks at some of the political issues elevated by the Republican Party recently and questions who these lawmakers are really representing.

title: White House says Biden is '100% fine' after he tripped boarding Air Force One
description: President Joe Biden is doing "100% fine" after he tripped while walking up the stairs to board Air Force One earlier Friday, White House principal deputy press secretary Karine Jean-Pierre said.

title: French artist JR unveils a monumental new optical illusion installation in Italy
description: Street artist JR, known for the larger-than-life photographic installations that took over Rio de Janerio during the 2016 Olympics, has now unveiled a towering optical illusion in Florence, Italy.

title: Sharon Stone says she was misled about explicit interrogation scene in 'Basic Instinct' -- Vanity Fair
description: Sharon Stone says she wasn't warned that her genitals would be exposed in the infamous interrogation scene in "Basic Instinct."

title: Porn star charged with reckless homicide after toad venom death
description: Spanish porn star Nacho Vidal has been charged with reckless homicide after a man died during a ceremony involving toad venom.

title: Hailey Bieber on marrying Justin 'insanely young'
description: Hailey Bieber knows getting married when you're in your 20s may not seem like such a good idea to many people, but for her and Justin Bieber, it worked.

title: Biden 'proud' of Biinken after tense exchange with Chinese officials
description: Alaska dispute between US and Chinese officials is an inauspicious start to a new era of relations

title: Europe has missed its chance to stop the third wave. The US could be next
BioNTech's co-founder: Vaccine protects against UK and South Africa variants
description: In an exclusive interview with CNN, BioNTech co-founder and chief medical officer Özlem Türeci talks about receiving one of Germany's highest honors, the Order of Merit, and about how her company's coronavirus vaccine is effective against the UK variant and the South African variant.

title: See Michelle Obama and Jimmy Fallon crash Zoom calls
description: Michelle Obama and late-night host Jimmy Fallon surprised unsuspecting Zoom callers who thought they were participating in a focus group.

title: Blue Ivy Carter wearing a crown and sipping out of her first Grammy is big energy
description: When your mom is Beyoncé and your dad is Jay-Z, it's expected that you have to stunt on people at least a little.

title: We asked Asian Americans about their experiences with hate. The responses were heartbreaking
Champions League quarterfinal draw: Bayern Munich to face PSG in repeat of 2020 final
description: It's crunch time in the Champions League.

title: My pandemic wedding story: three postponements and a fresh perspective
description: May 24, 2020 was the day my fiancé Dan and I had originally picked as our wedding day. Instead, we stood in the open doorway of his house in our sweats and laughed as a torrent of hail pelted down from the sky. The absurdity of a torrential hailstorm during a Texas summer on that particular day felt totally appropriate during those early months of the pandemic, when the whole world seemed turned upside down.

title: 'Q: Into the Storm' seeks to pull back the curtain on QAnon's origins
description: "Q: Into the Storm" bears a resemblance to an earlier HBO docuseries, "The Jinx," unfolding like a mystery, as the filmmaker plays mental chess with his subjects. What gives this six-part effort particular heft is the role QAnon has come to play in US politics, becoming, as director Cullen Hoback puts it, "part interactive game, part religion, part political movement."

title: Why one Florida city wants to build a two-mile tunnel to the beach
description: Fort Lauderdale, Florida tourists may be just a few years away from arriving at the beach in a Tesla driven in a tunnel, provided that Elon Musk can deliver, even with Florida's tricky geology.

title: Why Rand Paul's 'government worrywart' insult for Fauci is so off-base
description: Rand Paul is a Republican senator from Kentucky. He is also an ophthalmologist. What he is not is an infectious disease expert.

title: Westlife will play Wembley Stadium in August after signing new album deal
description: Westlife are making a comeback that's likely to leave fans raised up and flying without wings.

title: 'Girlhood' and 6 other unflinching stories about being young and female
description: Like many girls who grew up in the '90s, journalist Masuma Ahuja often found her own experiences reflected in Ann M. Martin's series "The Babysitters' Club." Her favorite character was the effortlessly polished Stacey McGill, but not necessarily for her style or New York City roots: Stacey, like Ahuja, is a Type I diabetic, and, as a child, Ahuja didn't know anyone else her age who dealt with the day-to-day complexity of the disease.

title: Just one day after completing CPR training, a teen saves her friend's life
description: With 30 compressions and two rescue breaths, 16-year-old Torri'ell Norwood saved her best friend's life, just a day after completing a basic life support class at her high school.

title: Supreme Court conservatives want to topple abortion rights -- but can't seem to agree on how
description: Conservative Supreme Court justices have demonstrated a desire to reverse prior decisions on abortion rights. The question, with Chief Justice John Roberts no longer the undisputed swing vote on abortion, is when and how far at least five justices will go to overturn rulings that support a constitutional right to end a pregnancy.

title: We met migrant teens who just crossed the border in Texas. Here's what they told us
description: In the pitch-black night, the teens' eyes blink in confusion as the bright beam of a constable's flashlight shines in their direction.

title: The UK's Royal Mint makes history with a new coin featuring Britannia as a woman of color
description: The Royal Mint, the British maker tasked with producing all of the UK's coinage, has released a new limited edition coin design depicting the national icon Britannia as a woman of color for the first time.

title: The continent is paying a high price for letting the epidemic get out of control. US experts are worried.
This country has just been named the happiest in the world
description: To say the past year has been a difficult one for people across the globe is something of an understatement.

title: 'Microaggressions' weigh on 'Black Ice' climber's shoulders
description: Whether it's a comment about his hair or questioning his expertise, professional ice climber Manoah Ainuu is aware that people notice the difference.

title: Mission to clean up space junk with magnets set for launch
description: It's invisible in the night sky, but above us there is a cloud of more than 9,000 tons of space junk -- equivalent to the weight of 720 school buses.

title: US plans to send vaccines to Canada. Hear local leader's ecstatic reaction
description: The Biden administration is finalizing plans to send millions of AstraZeneca Covid-19 vaccine doses to Mexico and Canada, according to White House press secretary Jen Psaki. CNN's Paula Newton reports.

title: Cubans are embarking on treacherous sea journeys as the economic crisis worsens
description: When Beatriz Jimenez closes her eyes, she sees her daughter and two young grandchildren and they are alive.

title: Tanzania swears in its first female president
description: Tanzanian Vice President Samia Suluhu Hassan was sworn in Friday as the country's first female president, two days after the death of President John Magufuli, one of Africa's most prominent Covid-19 skeptics, was announced.

title: Khabib Nurmagomedov officially retired, says UFC boss Dana White
description: He himself announced his retirement last year but the question still loomed: "Would Khabib Nurmagomedov make a shock return to the Octagon?"

title: 'I didn't want to be Asian at all,' college student tells CNN
description: Asian Americans are talking about the hate and racism they've experienced during the pandemic and, in some cases, their whole lives. If you have a story to share, submit it here.

title: China is raising the alarm over corporate surveillance. But it's got a massive network of its own
description: A popular annual consumer rights show in China has sparked a national debate about privacy and surveillance and sent companies scrambling to stay on Beijing's good side.

title: US-China meeting breaks into tense confrontation on camera
description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken, National Security Adviser Jake Sullivan, and Chinese diplomats had a tense exchange at a key first meeting in Alaska.

title: She wanted a dream house in Bali. This is what happened
description: Bali first captured Kayti Denham's heart when she came to the Indonesian island for her honeymoon in the 1980s.

title: Dr. Fauci explains why Rand Paul's mask claim is inaccurate
description: Dr. Anthony Fauci tells CNN's Chris Cuomo about his spar with Sen. Rand Paul (R-KY) over why Americans should wear masks after being vaccinated during a Senate hearing.

title: The lost children of Xinjiang
description: It was supposed to be a routine trip home to Xinjiang for Mamutjan Abdurehim's wife and two children.

title: With tradition and new tech, these Japanese designers are crafting more sustainably made clothing
description: In Japan, the term "mottainai" -- loosely translated to "what a waste" -- has deep roots. Originating from a Buddhist belief that every object has intrinsic value and should be utilized for its full life cycle, the credo has been threaded throughout national culture for centuries.
